content.user_title: Generate AI Voiceovers with One Command
content.value_statement: Create natural-sounding AI voiceovers for videos, podcasts, and audiobooks using command-line tools. Generate professional voiceovers in seconds without recording equipment.
actual_capabilities: Generate voiceovers using multiple TTS models including Kokoro, DIA, Chatterbox, Higgs, and VibeVoice
Select from 10+ voice options with different accents and speaking styles
Adjust speech speed and pacing with punctuation control
Create multi-voice conversations by generating separate audio tracks
Process long-form content in chunks for consistent audio quality
Merge audio files with crossfade effects for smooth transitions
limitations: Requires inference.sh CLI installation and account
Generates audio files that need external media software for editing
Long text requires chunking to maintain quality
Internet connection needed for TTS service
Premium voice models may have usage limits

prompt_templates.title: Quick Voiceover
prompt_templates.prompt: Generate a voiceover for [text]. Use [voice] style. Keep the tone [professional/casual/expressive]. Output the infsh command to execute.
prompt_templates.scenario: Quick voiceover generation for short content

prompt_templates.title: Multi-Speaker Dialogue
prompt_templates.prompt: Create a dialogue between two people discussing [topic]. Speaker A speaks [statement], Speaker B responds with [response]. Generate both audio files using different voices.

prompt_templates.title: Long-Form Narration
prompt_templates.prompt: Break this text into chunks of max 5000 characters for consistent voice quality: [text]. Generate each chunk with [voice], then merge with crossfade effects.

prompt_templates.title: Video Voiceover
prompt_templates.prompt: Create a voiceover for a video about [topic]. Use a professional voice and moderate speed (1.0). Generate the command to create audio for [video duration] seconds of content.

output_examples.input: Generate a professional voiceover for our quarterly earnings announcement.
output_examples.output: infsh app run infsh/kokoro-tts --input '{"text": "This is our quarterly earnings announcement. We are pleased to announce strong performance across all key metrics.", "voice": "am_michael"}'

output_examples.input: Create a conversation between a customer and support agent about billing issues.
output_examples.output:
Generate two audio files:
Customer: infsh app run infsh/kokoro-tts --input '{"text": "I need help with my subscription. The charges seem incorrect.", "voice": "af_sarah"}'
Agent: infsh app run infsh/kokoro-tts --input '{"text": "I apologize for the confusion. Let me check your billing details right away.", "voice": "am_echo"}'

best_practices: Use shorter sentences for more natural-sounding voiceovers
Match the voice selection to your content type and audience
Adjust speed to 0.9 for audiobooks and 1.1 for commercials
Add punctuation marks (periods, commas, ellipses) to control pacing
Process long content in 5000-character chunks for consistency
Use crossfade when merging multiple audio segments
anti_patterns: Using very long sentences without punctuation
Mixing multiple voices in a single command without merging
Generating voiceovers at inconsistent speeds across chunks
Using casual voices for professional business content
Attempting to clone voices with this tool (not supported)

faq.question: Do I need to record my own voice for voiceovers?
faq.answer: No. This tool uses AI to generate professional voiceovers. You can select from 10+ pre-trained voices with different accents and styles.

faq.question: What audio formats are supported?
faq.answer: The generated audio files can be used with any standard media player or video editing software. The service outputs audio in common formats compatible with most video editors.

faq.question: Can I use this for commercial projects?
faq.answer: Yes, the generated audio can be used in commercial content like videos, podcasts, and marketing materials. Check the inference.sh license terms for specific usage guidelines.

faq.question: How do I merge multiple audio files?
faq.answer: Use the media-merger app with crossfade settings. Add all generated audio files to the audio_files array and specify a crossfade duration in milliseconds.

faq.question: What's the maximum text length I can process?
faq.answer: The tool works best with content under 5000 characters per chunk. Longer text should be split into multiple segments for consistent voice quality.

faq.question: Which voice should I choose for professional content?
faq.answer: For professional business content, use male voices like 'am_michael' or 'am_echo' for authority, or female voices like 'af_nicole' for approachability. British accents (bf_emma, bm_george) work well for international audiences.
